product_description.AMOLED Display: The realme 8 features a 16.3 cm (6.4) Super AMOLED display that ensures a high contrast ratio and high brightness so that you can enjoy delightful visuals. Thanks to the 180 Hz touch sampling rate, you can enjoy smooth mobile usage that will make it difficult for you to put the phone down.
product_description.Helio G95 Gaming Processor: This mobile phone has a powerful Helio G95 Gaming processor so that you can enjoy lag-free usage while playing graphics-heavy games and multitasking. With up to eight cores and a high clock speed, you can enjoy the mobile phone’s powerful performance.
product_description.64 MP AI Quad Camera: Thanks to the 64 MP AI Quad Camera, you can take pictures in great clarity and detail. You can capture your subject from various perspectives with the ultra-wide, portrait, and macro lenses. You can also enjoy additional features, such as the UIS Max Video Stabilization mode so that you can take professional videos efficiently.
product_description.Tilt-shift Mode: The Tilt-shift mode of the mobile phone enables you to bring a new perspective to the images that you take so that you can enhance your creativity.
product_description.Starry Mode: With the Starry mode of the mobile phone, you can shoot for the stars by shooting the stars and much more while you're high up in the mountains.
product_description.Portrait Modes: You can use the Neon Portrait and Dynamic Bokeh mode to take dazzling portrait shots of your subject with eye-catching backgrounds.
product_description.Dual View Video: This mobile phone makes use of the dual view video feature so that you can enjoy the convenience of taking videos with the front and rear cameras simultaneously. This way, you can create creative content.
product_description.16 MP Selfie Nightscape: Thanks to the 16 MP In-display Selfie Camera, you can freeze all your favourite moments with your loved ones in time through stunning selfies. The selfie nightscape and AI portrait mode features can help add an aesthetic and unique touch to the selfies that you take.
product_description.30 W Dart Charge: This mobile phone supports the 30 W Dart Charge feature which enables it to completely recharge in up to 65 minutes. Thanks to the 5-level chip protection, your mobile phone will stay safe while it’s charging.
product_description.Powerful 5000 mAh Battery: The powerful 5000 mAh battery of the mobile phone allows you to game, stream content, and much more without interruptions so that you can use the device without worrying about running out of battery.
product_description.Light and Ultra Slim: The realme 8 features a slim and lightweight construction that makes it easy for you to hold and use. It’s built with strong yet lightweight materials, enabling you to enjoy comfortable usage.
product_description.realme UI 2.0: This mobile phone makes use of the realme UI 2.0 to give you access to connectivity, customisation, and a lot more upgrades so that your experience with the mobile phone keeps improving.
product_description.Hi-res Audio: Thanks to the Hi-res audio certification of the mobile phone, you get to experience rich sound quality that will make movies, music, and games a lot more enjoyable.

review:
Decent product at this price segment,
brave investment as a long term especially in terms of durability and reflective design ,storage ( but if you don't want durability ) ,
then you can go for redmi note 10 pro, which is far better option but still realme phones are far better than other handsets in durability

Detailed Review of Realme 8 ( used for 15 days )

1. Excellent display , Amoled display is really good for watching movies n for daily usage.. - 10/10
2. Battery backup - from 6 am(100%) in the morning till 5 pm in the evening , i did 3 online classes ( 1 hour each ) listened to some music , saw youtube , took 5 pics, did lot of calls and when i came back home at 5 i have 70% battery remaining.-9/10
3.finger print sensor - 88% of the time it was accurate n working , sometimes when ur hand is full of dust,oil,water it may not work properly..but 88% of the time it works so smooth..it takes 1 second to scan .but its worth it .the animation everything feels like u r holding a premium device -7/10
4.camera
1. 64 mp main sensor mode - clear and colourful images , really it shoots awesome pictures , its so clear n crispy , it adds colour to the pics ( boosting )-8/10
2.Ultrawide - its good , it takes beautiful images , but when you zoom in the clarity will go , its just a 8 mp sensor...but it clearly captures everything on frame -7/10
3.other 2 cameras - useless , the depth sensor is okay
4.portrait mode - it captures beautiful portrait pictures 75% of the time it captures perfect portrait keeping all d edges clear. The front camera also captures awsome portraits.- 7/10
5.The pictures are colour boosted , we feel like the pictures r taken from iphone ... Its realy colourful n clear on the photo mode n 64 MP
5.charging time - it takes 1 hr 10 minutes to charge , really good fast charging , doesnt heat heavily during charging - 9/10
6.front camera - to be frank , it wasnt good enough , its due to some software issues i think , the pictures taken on portrait mode were very good compared to normal photos , but it captures GOOD pictures .
7. VIDEO - THE PLACE WHERE THIS PHONE LOST ITS POWER. STABILIZATION , THE PHONE SUPPORTS EIS , ULTRA STEADY MODE , ULTRA STUDY MAX MODE , BUT IT DOESNT WORK WELL , THE NORMAL VIDEO MODE WORKS SO MUCH BETTER THAN THE UIS , UIS MAX MODE . THE NORMAL MODE CAPTURES STABLE VIDEO BUT NOT THAT STABLE , THIS CAN BE SOLVED BY SOME SOFTWARE UPDATES FOR THE CAMERA . THIS IS REALLY A BIG PROBLEM AND THE COMPANY SHOULD DO SOMETHING VERY QUICKLY -6/10
6.heating issues - this device doesnt heat up much ... Nice optimization -8/10
7.UI - realme ui 2.0 is really good .no ads...its very fluid , easy to use..better than mi ui and samsung ui
8.built quality - 8/10
9. Design - nyc design , the front looks like oneplus device , and back due to big cameras looks attractive
-8/10
10. PROCESSOR/ PERFORMANCE- VERY WELL OPTIMIZED , NO HEATING ISSUES , GAMING CHIP ACTUALLY , I PLAYED PUBG N ASPHALT , IT WAS GOOD , BUT IN HIGH GTAPHICS U CAN SEE FRAME DROPS , BUT FIR NORMAL GAMING ITS A BIG YES
11. storage - u get 128 gb of storage , (109 unused ) .
Nice mobile , awesome on screen finger print. Nice features nice look. New guesture features , new screenshot features.

The built quality is found to be better than any other android phone in this segment. Great package from Realme and quick delivery by Flipkart made this order a happier one.

Writing this review after 20 days of usage so here are some features which I found really good in this device is a good quality amoled display sporting under display fingerprint scanner, it gives around 1 day battery backup after full charge..not to forget it has 30watt dart charging technology which charges the Device very quickly. It is plastic built and has a glastic finesse which attracts too much fingerprints so please apply a case and use it and that's all I can say about it...will definitely update if I remember or find something which needs to be said about the device.

Posting this after 3 weeks usage. (Previously I owned Poco M2 Pro)

PROS:

Screen: Great amoled screen, gets pretty bright for outdoor usage. Colours are vivid with good viewing angles. Not a fast refresh screen but UI is smoother than Xiaomi phones so it feels almost same. Dragontrail glass protection is similar to Gorilla Glass 5.

Processor: GPU performance is great. CPU performance is similar to Snapdragon 720G. Overall for the price it's good

UI: Interface is fast, organised & bloatware free unlike Xiaomi phones. There's lag only for the time when you wake it up from standby. RAM management for 4GB variant is similar to Xiaomi phones with 6GB RAM.

Battery: Battery life is pretty good even with AOD on. Get around 2 days of normal usage with 8 hrs screen on time

Charging: Took exactly 66 mins to full charge. Around 40 mins gets it to 80-85%. More safe, efficient and fast than Xiaomi 33W chargers.

Calls & Connectivity: Clear audio during calls. No connectivity issues for WiFi or Bluetooth.

Body: At 177g it feels like the lightest phone in a long time. Good bodyweight distribution too. Despite a plastic body feel in hand is good.

CONS:

Biggest con is CAMERA. It is really horrible in indoor lighting. Does okayish in outdoor situation. Unoptimised Camera App is the main reason. GCAM results are pretty good. But still GCAM isn't too well optimised for Mediatek processors. Ultrawide is unusable for Indoor lighting. Produces average result in Outdoors.

Carrier aggregation is missing

Stereo speakers are obviously better but for a mono speaker it's loud enough.

Go for this phone over Redmi Note 10S (similar specs) only if you want good UI experience. Only reason I bought this is because Xiaomi phones are full of ads, bugs & lags.

It has been around 1 month since I got this device...
And let me detail the pros and cons:-
1. Screen - The AMOLED is gorgeous, and has vibrant colours, and looks very good
2. Under-display Fingerprint - It's speed is quite okay but it does lend a premium feel to the device.
3. Size and Weight - Compared to my Poco X3, this device feels super handy, and is quite comfortable to hold and use.
4. Battery - 5000 mAh, coupled with an AMOLED works wonders. There have been days where constantly watching movies/series for 5-6 hours is also not enough to kill the battery. Plus the charging is pretty good too
5. Plastic Back - This might not be for everyone, but many times, my previous phone has slipped out of my hand, or been dropped, so the not-fragile plastic back has an advantage.
6. Realme UI - Personally, I like Realme UI alot, so it's a plus for me.

Cons:-
1. Camera - The camera is a hit and miss, sometimes it takes wonderful photos, other times not so much... I hope Realme is able to fix this with future updates.
2. Processor (Maybe) - Helio G95 has been shown to overheat under some conditions, but since I don't use my device heavily, I haven't encountered this yet.
3. Plastic Back - As I said, it depends on personal preferences... Glass might feel premium, but plastic is more drop-resistant.

For those who say Helio G95 heats alot, This phone heats a bit but not that much it just slightly warms up during heavy usage like BGMI,kinemaster,filmora etc. Battery backup is decent gives 1 day backup in average use. charges in just 1hrs. Some people say camera is too bad because it is Omnivision sensor but I don't think that it is too bad it captures nice and detailed photos, camera app is a slight disappointed because it boost green colour a lot and most time doesn't capture the details, so it needs improvement I think there are a lot of tools in camera app to satisfy your needs. Guys I use modded gcam and it captured photos with more detail and with natural colours. So go for a modded gcam. Display is really nice, pitch black, 1000 nits brightness makes display visible under direct sunlight. Underdisplay finger print is not very fast but it is pretty fast I never had any problem with it, it even unlocks if your finger is slighly wet. only 1 thing that is a problem is it get minor scratches even if you use back cover provided within the box

Review after a month of usage:

Phone is light and will distributed weight for the battery size. Also phone is slimmer than competition with same battery.

Camera: above average. 8/10: good photos for 64mp, sometimes oversaturated. Night photos are good and bright enough. You will like it's front camera as well.

Software: full of bloats. 8/10: some are removable and some can be disabled. Overall optimization for Speed and battery is great.

Battery: good. 10/10: lasted a little more than one and a half days. Charging time around an hour with a few minutes up and down.

Display: 7/10: good display with no problem using in direct sunlight. Colours are well saturated. Amoled is this price range is rare.

Fingerprint: on screen. Fast. 10/10 for price range

Overall this phone is good for people who play games if you get it for less than 14k

Pros -
1. Processor good for playing cod and bgmi in high setting . No frame drops and lags
2. Light weight and slim .(than Samsung phones which are bulky and heavy in this range )
3. Ui is smooth and stable with no bugs at all
4. Battery and charging perfect for running all day with 6-7 hrs use time
5. Compact easy to use with one hand

Cons -
1. Camera is bad in low light and there is no stability in video recording and selfi is ok but overall 3/10
(Samsung's camera is much better in this range like f41 or other)
3. Don't buy 4gb ram varient go with 6gb for better performance around 15000 and not more than that . 4. Default mode is not 64 mp you have to always shift to that and the major problem of this phone - while taking photos with 64 mp mode it take long time to click and process photos this is a bug or I don't know but it's camera is slow (photos with simple photo mode and with 64 mp mode are exact same)
2. Don't have good back cases in the market unlike samsung

Conclusion
Good for those who want compact light phone with good processor for gaming and smooth scrolling and watching movies videos and clean stock ui with many customisation features (unlike samsung) and focus mode and many other features for students.

If you want good camera go for samsung in this price range

Finally, I was able to purchase the realme 8 smartphone!!

First things first, when you hold & feel the mobile phone in your hands, you will feel really sturdy and strong which is the built quality. However, it's back is a fingerprint magnet! Yeah, every time you touch it's back w/out cover, you'll see your fingerprints mark there. So, you have to use a back case while using this phone.


Talking about camera, it's really good (thanks to the Sony IMX sensors), but the front camera clicks just decent pictures, so not expect too much from that. But I will give 5/5 in back camera.

About its performance, well, it supports MTK G 95 processor, which runs day-to-day applications really smooth and well. Also, as "G" stands for gaming, you can easily rely on it when it comes to gaming. Be it COD, BGMI, Fortnite, the processor will run any of them with ease.

Moreover, the mammoth 5,000 mAh baterry will easily last upto a day with normal usage (including bit of intense gaming). And the battery supports 30 Watts fast charging, which charges the battery from 0-100 within an hour.

Finally, coming to it's display, it has a SUPER AMOLED Display, which is wayyy better than normal IPS LED displays out there in the market at this price range, so yeah, the phone won't let you down in this segment too!

The Realme 8 offers a competent smartphone package for anyone looking to spend less than £200. In skipping 5G, you get a vibrant FHD+ AMOLED display, a reasonably capable 64-megapixel camera, plus superior gaming performance over the Realme 8 5G. However, there are a few quirks and glitches here that may need addressing, while those hoping for genuine progress over the (at the time) impressive Realme 7 will be disappointed.

Pros
Vibrant AMOLED display
Decent gaming performance
Excellent battery life
Cons
Display only 60Hz
Camera has focusing issues in low light
Glitchy software
If you want multimedia experience and camera is not in priority then go for it, don't worry about out dated processor.

I have been using this phone since 10 days. So I am sharing some of my experience here:
Pros
1. You will get fully charged in 1 hour only { thanks for providing 30w dart charger}
2. Super amoled display which enhances your viewing experience.
3. Realme UI 2.0
4. Very good touch response even though it is 60hz display.
5. Light weight .

Cons:
1. Battery draining problem { even if you switch on battery saving mode}
2. Cameras not up to the mark
3. Speakers are not crystal clear { if you put volume to high the entire phone is vibrating}
4. There is no Fm radio in it. If you want then you have to install a third party app, which works with internet only.
5. In this price range realme has to provide carrier aggregation and stereo speaker..

First of all I have researched a lot before buying this mobile coz I have to use it for a long term so from my experience after recieving the product what I've observed are:

BATTERY: Excellent battery life, it lasts 1 day easily with playing pubg and other games for 3-4 hrs and consuming social media and some YouTube for 2-3hrs. If you are a normal user you can easily get more than 1 day

CHARGING: 30W charger is bundled in the box and it gets a little bit hot depending on the room temperature and it's quite normal it takes 50-65min to completely charge my device from 15-100%.

DISPLAY: As for me the display is quite good and dark mode is too good there are no issues till now.

PERFORMANCE: I've played pubg on smooth+ultra settings and it ran smoothly but it ls fps fluctuates between 35-40 and don't expect 60fps but there are no frame drops or lags I've noticed few but they are due to my network. So G95 is pretty powerful chipset and makes the job done.

CAMERA: Like everybody says it's camera is not upto the mark but if you are just like me who prefer performance over cameras then go for it if you want better pictures u can use g_cam anytime😊

CONS: If u have purchased this mobile don't rush and update it to A13 security patch because even though it improves the camera a little bit the consumption of battery has become more so please avoid that.
And add a back cover because it's back is prone to scratches easily. And it says "don't use any other protective glass for display as it might not make ur fingerprint recognised " so I haven't yet applied any glass on it, screen protector is pre-applied.

So, if you want a mobile for long term usage and prefer performance over cameras then you can go for it..

As I am using Realme products for around 2 years I know product quality is very good. This one is as expected.

* Camera: very good. Easy to focus and the clarity. 64 megapixel results area very detailed.

* Build quality: very good build. Looks like a masterpiece with very asthenic built. The chrome finish in the back and the ring it makes it Bhid Main Alag. It's also very slim not expecting a battery of 5000 mah in it.

* Sound: sound quality is very good. But not able distinguished any difference as it is Dirac sound.

* Processor: It's very fast without any lag. The main lagging issues occurred after the mobile used for a year. As I am using Realme 5 pro which is around 2 years without any lag. So hoping it will do so as new generation processor and technology can do better.

* UI: very simple and easy to use. Not complex bit like other brands. Making simple anything lots of high grade technology used.

* Display: The display is Amoled. It's pleasing to watch, but not like Samsung as both have different technologies. Still one will fully satisfied.

Final Verdict: It's value for money product in the market. It will be better buy than Realme 8 5g compared to price and specifications. So go for it as I bought it in 14000/.

Delivery : - I am really appreciate the fastest ever delivery by an online sites. I ordered around 9.30 pm in the night and got it in the morning 11.30 pm. It's really amazing. Even local shops won't deliver in that sort of time and gave lots of execuses.

Finally I am giving thanks to Flipkart and their team for their dedicated efforts to organize such a appreciable manner with lots of obstacles they face.
